original: Holmstrand, Lars Gunnar Dag Edvard, seminarieadjunkt, Skara, f. 17/4/ 05 i Karlstad av sem :lär. Edvard H. o. Mathrlda Johansson. G. 44 m. UUa Lindeblad. — Stud:ex. i Karlstad 24, folikskoll:ex. där 25, fil. kand. 29, fil. mag. s. å. o. fil. lic. 42 v. Gbgs hög-sk. Res. t. Tyskl. o. Schweiz 22, Tyskl., Schweiz o. Ital. 31, HoH. 39. Vik. lär. v. Gbgs folksk. 27, e. o. 3’3, ord. 39, tf. folkskolinsp. i Värml. mell. insp :omr. somr. 42, 43, i Norrb. södra insp :omr. 44, vik. övn iskollär. v.. Karlstads folksk :sem. 45-46, vik. lektor v. Falu folksk :sem. 46, e. o. adj. v. Skara småsk:sem. 46-47, lär. i psyk. o. pedag. v. Slöjdfören. sk. i Gbg 42, adj. v. småskisem, i Skara fr. 47. Sekr. 32, v. ordf. 33 i Gbgs högsk. studikår, v. ordf. o. skattmäst. i Gbgs stud:teat. 32-38, v. ordf. i Utrikespol. fören. i Gbg 38-44, ordf. fr. 44.
translated: Holmstrand, Lars Gunnar Dag Edvard, seminar teacher, Skara, b. April 17th, 1905 in Karlstad to seminar teacher Edvard H. and Mathilda Johansson. Married in 1944 to Ulla Lindeblad. He passed his student exam in Karlstad in 1924, followed by teacher training exam in 1925. He received a bachelor's degree in 1929, a master's degree the same year, and a PhD in 1942 from Gothenburg University where he travelled to Germany and Switzerland in 1922, 1931, and to Holland in 1939. He worked as a substitute teacher at Gothenburg's elementary school in 1927, becoming the permanent teacher in 1939, temporary superintendent for primary schools in Värmland's inspection area during the summer of 1942 and 43, south Norrbotten's inspection area in 1944. He was a temporary teacher at Karlstad's elementary school from 1945-1946, a substitute lecturer at Falu's elementary school in 1946, a deputy teacher at Skara's nursery school from 1946-1947, and a teacher in psychology and pedagogy at the Association of Craftsmen's School in Gothenburg in 1942, a deputy teacher at Skara's nursery school in 1947. He was secretary in 1932, vice president in 1933 of the Gothenburg University Student Union, vice president and treasurer of the Student Theatre in Gothenburg from 1932-1938, vice president of the Foreign Policy Association in Gothenburg from 1938-1944, and president from 1944 onwards.
